summary: A collection of utilities for normalizing, comparing, and merging bibliographic records from various sources (e.g., Amazon, MARC) into the Open Library catalog. It includes tools for cleaning identifiers, standardizing titles and author names, building simple key/value databases, indexing records, loading JSON data, and applying multi‑level merge strategies to deduplicate and consolidate catalog entries.
business_intent: To enhance the Open Library catalog by automatically detecting and consolidating duplicate or overlapping records, integrating external metadata sources, and maintaining consistent, high‑quality bibliographic data.
